thread.title: German exports see steepest fall in near 7 years
thread.title_full: German exports see steepest fall in near 7 years | Business Spectator

author: Dow Jones newswires
title: German exports see steepest fall in near 7 years
text:
Germany's trade surplus missed forecasts in August, as exports registered their steepest decline in almost seven years.
Germany's trade surplus, adjusted for seasonal swings and calendar effects, narrowed to €19.6 billion ($US22.1 billion) from a revised €22.4 billion in July, undershooting forecasts of €22.5 billion, data from the Federal Statistical Office showed on Thursday.
Exports slumped by 5.2 per cent from the preceding month to €97.7 billion in adjusted terms in August. That was the steepest decline since January 2009, an economist at Destatis said.
Imports fell by 3.1 per cent on the month to €78.2 billion. However, the Destatis economist said the economic method of seasonal adjustment may not fully capture the summer vacation effect.
Germany's current account balance, a broad measure of an economy's international financial position, showed a surplus of €12.3 billion in August in unadjusted terms. That was well below economists' forecasts of a €16.2 billion surplus. By comparison, the current account surplus in August last year was €11.1 billion.
